special_cp.overview: Machamp's has 3455 max CP (at Level 50). A Machamp obtained from Raids can be encountered from 1667 CP to 1746 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 2084 CP to 2183 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Machamp can be found in the 1250 CP to 1310 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

meta_analysis: Machamp in the meta PvE Analysis ‚öîÔ∏è Raids ‚Äì The champ is here! While it's dropped a few places over time, Machamp remains an excellent Fighting -type attacker and a budget one at that. You'll generally see at least one show up when battling Normal , Rock , Ice , Steel , or Dark -type raid bosses. üõ°Ô∏è Gyms ‚Äì The Fighting type doesn't make a favorable gym defender, but Machamp can be useful to overthrow the bulky defenders like Blissey and Slaking as the King of the Ring. PvP Analysis üîµ Great League - If Machoke is good in Great League , then Machamp is better. With the help of some legacy moves available with Elite TMs , Machamp has decent coverage against some of its counters. üü° Ultra League - Four punchy arms seem to give it the strength needed to compete in this higher league. As with Great League , you'll need to invest some Elite TMs to get your Machamp fighting fit for these battles. üü£ Master League - At this level, Machamp becomes outclassed by stronger Fighting types but could still punch above its weight in the right matchup.

mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Machamp
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Machamp's Fighting-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Machamp.

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Machamp's height ranges from 0.78 m to 2.8 m, with the average being 1.6 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

pokedex.entry: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this POK√©MON fires off awesome punches.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
MACHAMP has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This POK√©MON tends to leap into action before it thinks.

MACHAMP is known as the POK√©MON that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
Its superpowerful punches are said to knock the victim flying clear over the horizon.
It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

Machamp is known as the Pok√©mon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it ‚Äúthe Machamp special.‚Äù
With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It‚Äôs said to have mastered every martial art in the world.
One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pok√©mon fires off awesome punches.
It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pok√©mon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

faq.question: What are Machamp‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Fighting-type Pok√©mon, Machamp is weak to Fairy, Flying, and Psychic-type moves.

faq.question: What are the best moves for Machamp in Pok√©mon GO?
faq.answer: The best moves for Machamp in Pok√©mon GO are Counter and Dynamic Punch. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 13.617 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 245.163.

faq.question: How does Machamp perform in Raids?
faq.answer: Machamp struggles to perform in Raids.

faq.question: How does Machamp rank as a Fighting-type attacker?
faq.answer: Machamp is a solid A-Tier Fighting-type attacker, ranking at number #29. It is reliable in many situations but not the absolute best.

faq.question: What Mega Pok√©mon boost Machamp?
faq.answer: The following Mega Pok√©mon boost Machamp: Mega Heracross, Mega Blaziken, Mega Medicham, Mega Lopunny, Mega Lucario, and Mega Gallade.

faq.question: What is Machamp‚Äôs maximum CP at Level 40 and Level 50?
faq.answer: Machamp‚Äôs maximum CP at Level 40 is 3056 CP and 3455 CP at Level 50.
